mdRecord.dcterms:title: East Parlor, Mt. Vernon Mansion
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, N. G. (Newton G.)
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: N. G. Johnson, only authorized publisher of Mount Vernon views
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of the Little Parlor including the harpsichord and relic case. The label on the reverse reads: In which stands the case for the exhibition of interesting relics of Washington, containing a bust of Washington, supposed to be the original, by the French sculptor Houdon
his clothes, dress-sword, globe, and his Tripod with which he commenced life as a Surveyor.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (VA : Estate)
George Washington's Mount Vernon
Mansion interior
